channel.title: - Articles
channel.description: A blog or a portfolio or even both!

item.title: Professor Murphy's Wooden Puzzle
item.description: An AR step-by-step guide for a puzzle.

item.title: UDK Environment
item.description: One of my early personal projects, I wanted to learn the UDK engine and it´s asset workflow.

item.title: Test Drive Unlimited 2
item.description: As an intern in Lyon, France, I was responsible for designing various areas in the game “Test Drive Unlimited 2”. Making sure areas were more intriguing and aligned with the other areas inside the game.

item.title: The Showdown Effect
item.description: Part of the core team at the launch of the computer game “Showdown Effect”. I was responsible for mocking up levels and prototyping art assets. During the alpha version I had the responsibility for various 3D models and assets.

item.title: NORM
item.description: Here, I got the opportunity to apply my competence within game development on the market research industry. With clients such as FMCG companies like Nestlé, Unilever etc. we performed quantitative, web-based user tests for new concepts, new designs, brand repositioning projects, and more. I was part of the team that built all the surveys, and also solely responsible for all 3D graphical layout. I was employed specifically for my background in game development and the go-to guy for 3D solutions. I created virtual 3D stores like pharmacies and grocery stores when clients had new and innovative store concepts that they wanted to test on end-consumers. I also spearheaded the in-house development of 3D, developing new ways of virtualizing shopper experience at point-of-purchase using VR & 3D.

item.title: Highpoly project
item.description: A school project I did, building a highpoly and focusing on hardsurfaces.
